title: Tour de France 2021 Standings after Stage 5
content:
General Classification / Yellow Jersey

The battle for the GC truly began on Stage 5. With an emphatic stage victory, Pogacar has moved into second place, with Van der Poel just holding onto yellow. Behind those two we have the beginnings of a GC ranking that may prove persistent in the weeks to come.

1. Mathieu van der Poel
2. Tadej Pogacar +0:08
3. Wout Van Aert +0:30
4. Julian Alaphilippe +0:48
5. Alexey Lutsenko +1:21
6. Pierre Latour +1:28
7. Rigoberto Uran +1:29
8. Jonas Vingegaard +1:43
9. Richard Carapaz +1.44
10. Primož Roglič +1.48

Tour de France 2021 Guide

Points Classification / Green Jersey

Picking up points in the intermediate sprint and taking the stage win on stage 4, the green jersey is now on the shoulders of Mark Cavendish. It was the Manx rider's 31st stage win, an extremely popular victory among fans who have followed his rise back to the top of the sport following his struggles with illness in recent years.

1. Mark Cavendish - 89 points
2. Julian Alaphilippe - 84 points
3. Mathieu van der Poel - 78 points
4. Michael Matthews - 78 points
5. Nacer Bouhanni - 74 points

King of the Mountains Classification / Polka-Dot Jersey

A time trial stage meant no KOM sprints in stage 5, meaning the jersey stays with the BORA-Hansgrohe rider for another day.

1. Ide Schelling - 5 points
2. Mathieu van der Poel - 4 points
3. Anthony Perez - 3 points
4. Julian Alaphilippe - 2 points
5. Edward Theuns - 2 points

Young Rider's Classification / White Jersey

The white jersey remains, unsurprisingly, with Pogačar after his stage 5 victory. Jonas Vingegaard has upset the remaining order, though, by slotting into second place. Behind him the standings remain the same as after stage 4, but with larger time gaps to the top.

1. Tadej Pogačar
2. Jonas Vingegaard +1:35
3. David Gaudu +2:27
4. Sergio Higuita +2:58
5. Lucas Hamilton +3:51

Team Classification

1. Team Jumbo-Visma
2. EF Education - Nippo +2:25
3. Bahrain - Victorious +3:02
4. Astana - Premier Tech +3:23
5. Deceuninck–Quick-Step +3:25

Cover image: A.S.O./Alex Broadway
author: Peter Stuart
